title: The Interactive Guide to Rendering in React
preview: React, in its purest form, is a library for building user interfaces. It's so simple that the entire mental model can be represented as a formula, v = f(s) â€“ where your view is simply a function of your state. When React renders a component, two things happen. First, React creates a snapshot of your component which captures everything React needs to update the view at that particular moment in time. props, state, event handlers, and a description of the UI (based on those props and state) are all captured in this snapshot. From there, React takes that description of the UI and uses it to update the View. In order to get the starting UI for your application, React will do an initial render, starting at the root of your application.
